title: PAI Celebrates the Life of Dr. Nafis Sadik, Champion of Women’s Reproductive Health and Rights - PAI

quotes: The PAI board of directors and staff mourn the loss of Dr. Nafis Sadik, a forceful and visionary leader who died on August 14 in New York City at the age of 92.

Upon her appointment as executive director of the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) in 1987, Dr. Sadik became the first women in the history of the United Nations (U.N.) to lead one of its major voluntarily funded programs
After her retirement from the U.N. in 2000, she became an active member of the PAI board, offering insightful and valuable advice to the PAI staff.

Dr. Sadik began her professional life as a physician practicing obstetrics and gynecology with the army and in rural communities in Pakistan, which culminated in her appointment as director-general of Pakistan’s Central Family Planning Council in the late 1960s.
At a memorial service held at U.N. headquarters on September 1, Alex Marshall, Dr. Sadik’s longtime speechwriter at UNFPA, recounted what might have been her ‘origin story’
